name: JavaServer FacesServlet Pointer
summary: The .faces extension is used by some versions of JavaServer Faces to invoke the FacesServlet servlet . However, FACES files do not actually exist. When developers specify a path to a FACES file (e.g. http://localhost:8080/webapp/page.faces ), JavaServer Faces searches for and renders the FacesServlet components included in an app's corresponding WebContent .XHTML file (e.g. Webapp/WebContent/page.xhtml ).

open.note: Open with an associated app listed below.
